dialogue.speaker: Princess LuL첫
text: . . .What?
How?
Why?
Why did you come all this way?

dialogue.speaker: Pippi
text: Because you were in peril.

dialogue.speaker: Princess LuL첫
text: I could have endured.
I would have carved my path out.

dialogue.speaker: Pippi
text: I know, but nce sworn as the knight of the realm, I could not stand idle.

dialogue.speaker: Princess LuL첫
text: You are not bound to that vow any longer.
My place is with the kingdom.
My people await me, my crown commands me.
You shall ever be welcome, but I cannot dwell at your side.
Why do you still come to me?

dialogue.speaker: Pippi
text: Because I cannot turn away.
Because I dread the day our bond is remembered as dust and folly.
I cannot let it be cast aside, as if it were nothing.
Letting our victories turn to empty tales, forgotten by time.
And perhaps that day has already come. . .

dialogue.speaker: Princess LuL첫
text: I have never sworn to forsake you.
You shielded me, and peace was restored.
I thank you in name of the whole kingdom
but I can grant no more than this.
Why give so much for so little?

dialogue.speaker: Pippi
text: Because it is not nothing.
It is all that is left to me, and the most precious I shall ever hold.
It must not fade as though it never was, nor be judged unworthy
For I could serve no other as I have served you,
and none would guard you as I have
This is no plea for reward, it is the keeping of what must not be lost.
you
